section.text: Any violation of this chapter is both a civil offense and a misdemeanor criminal offense. The fine for a criminal violation of this chapter shall be up to five hundred dollars ($500.00) or larger if allowed by G.S. 14-4. Misdemeanor violations shall be enforced by the issuance of citations or by arrest according to the same procedures used for other criminal violations.

The first violation of this chapter shall subject the violator to a civil penalty of fifty dollars ($50.00); the second violation during a twelve-month period shall be subject to a one hundred dollar ($100.00) penalty; the third and subsequent violations shall be subject to a one hundred fifty dollar ($150.00) penalty. Notwithstanding this schedule of penalties, the fourth and subsequent violations of §12-3021 et seq. of this chapter (Public Nuisance Animals) shall subject the violator to a two hundred fifty dollar ($250.00) penalty. Civil citations shall be served personally upon the violator by the animal control officer, by a member of the Raleigh Police Department, or by any other means authorized for the service of civil process by the North Carolina Rules of Civil Procedure.
